channel.title: [317 PI] Webclient error
channel.description:
Every time I open my webclient, it gives me this error:
[code] Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-2" java.lang.IllegalStateException: Applet's parent container not set up at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.start(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.main.client.PluginMain$StartAppletRunner.run(Unknown Source) at java.awt.event.InvocationEvent.dispatch(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEventImpl(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventQueue.access$200(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventQueue$3.run(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventQueue$3.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.security.ProtectionDomain$1.doIntersectionPrivilege(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForFilters(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForFilter(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(Unknown Source) CacheEntry[https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/44619708/client.jar]: updateAvailable=true,lastModified=Thu Jan 01 01:00:00 CET 1970,length=18185062 [/code]
Does anyone know why it appears? Any help would be appreciated!

item.description:

Well, I am still getting this error: UnsupportedClassVersionError: [code]Java Plug-in 10.60.2.19

item.title: [317 PI] Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Change your compiler to this

@echo off Title Building... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_60\bin\javac.exe" *.java sign\*.java pause
And recompile. You didn’t compile the signlink with the rest of the client.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @neroxx neroxx
item.description:
@neroxx wrote:

Alright, now I downloaded jdk 7 and java 7:

then I changed the path in my compiler to: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_05\bin\javac.exe

Now, it looks like this: @echo off Title Building... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_05\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

When I compile it says: warning: .\sign\signlink.class: major version 52 is newer than 51, the highest m ajor version supported by this compiler. It is recommended that the compiler be upgraded. Note: client.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 warning Press any key to continue . . .

I also changed my clients path to: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_60\bin\javaw.exe

Now, it looks like this: @echo off title Sillyland - Loading... cd ./files/ "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_60\bin\javaw.exe" -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

When I try to run the client, it doesn’t work at all. The cmd gives me this error: [code]THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY
DOUBLE-CLICK THE “client.jar” TO RUN IT

Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/)

C:\Users\Q6600\Desktop>“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_60\bin\java.exe” -jar cli
ent.jar
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: sign/signlink
: Unsupported major.minor version 52.0
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:800)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:14
2)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:449)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:71)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:361)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:355)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:354)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:425)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:308)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:358)
at client.main(client.java:2716)
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

whats the problem? :S

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xX4m4zingXx, post:8, topic:544051”]use 7, because 8 isn’t yet supported in browsers i think.
so just compile using 7 and then it should work.[/quote]
Has nothing to do with browser support, the browser passes it onto your computer to the java.exe itself.
Java 8 is still technically beta and not publicly released. Therefore it should not be used for jar’ing.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:

so just compile using 7 and then it should work.

item.title: [317 PI] Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Unsupported major minor error is the real error…

version 52.0 is JDK/JRE 8 and above.
Your Environmental Vars are set to JDK 7.
So you may want to either get JDK/JRE 8 or compile with JDK 7.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @neroxx neroxx
item.description:
@neroxx wrote:

Nah, I’m not really using RSWebclients, I just tried it as the other I used didn’t work either.

The applet code for my last html page was:

[code]

[/code] (Webclient code: http://pastebin.com/C9EjG1BA)

I don’t think it’s my java permissions, as I accept to run the application, and my java security settings are at medium.

this is whats popping up when I head over to the webclient:

When I click ‘details’, this is what it says:

Uhm, my environmental variables is: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_15\bin
no idea about that.

I’m pretty much willing to pay to get this fixed if it’s possible…

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Webclient error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You’re using RSWebclients? Ew.
However, reading online the error seems very obscure.
Double check your java permissions.
Some people say the error may not even be related to your file and that it may be browser sided.
Also check your environmental variables, as some people said that was an issue.

Read full topic

item.description:
@neroxx wrote:

Every time I open my webclient, it gives me this error:

Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-2" java.lang.IllegalStateException: Applet's parent container not set up
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.start(Unknown Source)

Does anyone know why it appears? Any help would be appreciated!
